editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.note: Quaestio-titles are given in the lower margins throughout, and there is some, but not copious, annotation. The condition of the parchment, however, shows that the book was heavily used.

physDesc.p: Two originally separate volumes, together early.

supportDesc.extent:
168 leaves (ii + 166) 290 200
235 150
Retrimmed with loss of marginalia. Fols. i-ii, 164–6, are of thick, stiff parchment.
supportDesc.collation: A bifolium, 1–312, 410, 5–1112 / 1212(+ 1, a column wide, after 6), 1312, 148, 154(1 canc.); the quires numbered at the end in pencil.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 48–52 lines.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on five bands; formerly chained from the usual position.

history.provenance: The secundo folio reading identifies it as UO46. 68, ‘in xvii quaternis ligatus et sine asceribus’, bequeathed by John of Sandwich (BRUO 1639–40), fellow in 1321, still in 1324. In UO48. 118 it is described as ‘quaternus’, in UO50. 57 as ‘expositorem sex principiorum’, in UO51. 33 as ‘expositorem logice’.

At the foot of f. 77 are pencilled the names ‘Iohannes Westram’ and ‘Robertus Derby’, s. xiv. The second may have been Robert de Derby (BRUO 571), fellow of Oriel College in 1360, until his death, by July 1361.
Inside the front cover, on a sheet of paper, are a table of contents, s. xvii, ‘Q. 2. 12. Art:’, s. xvii, canc. and replaced with modern ‘K. 1. 6 (CCXCVI)’, in red ink, and the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, p. 117; Powicke, no. 126; Dondaine & Shooner, no. 2144.

msItem.title: Quaestiones on PORPHYRY, Isagoge
msItem.incipit: Sicut dicit Aristoteles secundo metaphysice inconueniens est simul querere scientiam et modus sciendi
msItem.explicit: et per continens tocius libri Porphirii sentencia explicit.
msItem.note: Also in Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibl. Clm 9677, pp. 221–36.

msItem.title: Quaestiones on ARISTOTLE, Praedicamenta
msItem.incipit: Incipit summa libri predicamentorum. Equiuoca dicuntur ...; Ex prius dictis apparet in diuisione logices quid sit subiectum
msItem.explicit: et de breuitate siue paucitate istorum modorum et apparet.
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt sentencie super librum Predicamentorum Aristotelis.

msItem.author: PETRUS DE SANCTO AMORE
msItem.title: Sententia Libri Perihermenias
msItem.incipit: Primum oportet constituere &c. Quid debeat dici subiectum in hac scientia? Patet ex diuisione logices
msItem.explicit: et per consequens tocius libri periarmenias.
msItem.note: Unpr.; Lohr, p. 370, citing only Basel, Universitätsbibl. V. IV. 35, fols. 47–61 (s. xiii).

msItem.author: H. BRYGGEMORE
msItem.title: Super VI Principia
msItem.incipit: Forma est compositioni contingens &c. Supposito quod sex principia sunt causa materialis
msItem.explicit: per modum priuacionis est generacio secundum quid. Et hec ad presens de vi. principiis sufficiant amen amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt sentencie super librum sex principiorum.
msItem.note: Unpr.; Lohr, p. 211, citing only Bodl. Libr., Rawl. A. 428, fols. 59-(96), s. xv; the version here is obviously much shorter. Sharpe, Handlist, p. 158, not this copy. Nothing is known of the author.

msItem.author: BOETHIUS OF DACIA
msItem.title: Quaestiones on ARISTOTLE, Topica
msItem.incipit: Cum honorandi uiri uidelicet patres nostri reuerendi primo philosophantes
msItem.explicit: ad principium de arte sophistici incipientes dicamus.

msItem.author: THOMAS AQUINAS
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, Posterior Analytics.
msItem.incipit: Sicut dicit Aristotiles in principio Methaphysice hominum genus arte et rationibus uiuit
msItem.explicit: (ends impf. in lect. 36) non sit aliquod medium propositionis date non poterit

msItem.author: Ps.-PETRUS DE HIBERNIA
msItem.title: Commentary on ARISTOTLE, Posteriora Analytica
msItem.incipit: Omnis doctrina et omnis disciplina &c. Sicut dicit Aristoteles primo et xº ethicorum felicitas hominis est operatio perfecta secundum uirtutem
msItem.note: Excerpts ed. S. Ebbesen and J. Pinborg, ‘Studies in the Logical Writings attributed to Boethius of Dacia’, CIMA 3 (1970), pp. 1–54, at 17–22; Lohr, p. 355; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 428, two copies, not this one.

handDesc.handNote: A university hand, writing gothic rotunda with some anglicana forms, using very black ink. The lemmata are written in larger and more formal script.

decoDesc.decoNote: None: unfilled spaces for initials and rubrics; a very few rubrics supplied.

msItem.author: WILLIAM ROTHWELL
msItem.title: De Principiis Naturae
msItem.incipit: Queritur de principiis et primo de materia prima an sit ens
msItem.note: Unpr.; Kaeppeli 1644; Sharpe, Handlist, p. 806, citing this and three other copies.

msItem.title: Quaestiones super Priscianum Minorum
msItem.incipit: Innata est nobis uia a nocioribus nobis in nociora
msItem.explicit: uenio ad me legendam Virgilium et hec precamen supradictam. Explicit.
msItem.note: Unpr.; Pinborg, Sprachlogik, p. 321 (A 71); also in Bodl. Libr., Digby 55, fols. 131–51, a different reportatio.

decoDesc.decoNote: None: unfilled spaces for initials and rubrics.
